data.title: How much is an English actor Raza Jaffrey net worth? wife
data.meta_description: As of December 2021, Raza Jaffrey net worth is estimated to be $2 million. He is currently married to Lara Pulver, an English actress,
data.text:
Raza Jaffrey is an English actor and singer who featured in the CBS TV medical drama Code Black as Neal Hudson. He is well recognized for his role as Zafar Younis in BBC One’s spy drama Spooks. To learn more about Raza Jaffrey net worth, earnings, income, wife, and wiki, scroll down.

How much is Raza Jaffrey net worth? How much is his salary?

As of December 2021, Raza Jaffrey net worth is estimated to be $2 million. His income is primarily derived from his successful acting career. His annual pay, however, is currently unclear. However, it is thought that he gets tens of thousands of dollars per episode from the TV shows on which he has appeared. Similarly, according to internet sources, an average British actor can earn £27,333 ($38625.63) each year, while an experienced British actor can earn £78,000 ($110225.70) per year. As a result, we presume that, as a veteran British actor, his annual income is in the hundreds of thousands of dollars.

Jaffrey, Raza In the future, his net worth will undoubtedly rise. Jaffrey and his wonderful family, which includes his wife, Lara Pulver, and their adorable son, Ozias Jaffrey, who is presently four years old, are living a happy and extravagant lifestyle thanks to his amassed wealth.

Read More: ‘Lost In Space’ actress Sibongile Mlambo husband, net worth

How did he start his professional career?

Raza Jaffrey is a fantastic actress. In 1999, he made his television debut in the TV drama Eastenders. Mr. Datani was his character on the show. In the year 2000, he appeared in the television show Casualty. Murder Investigation Team (2005), Sharpe’s Peril (2008), The Cape (2011), Death in Paradise (2014), Adventure Time (2017), and others are among his previous small role TV productions. However, he is most recognized for his 23-episode appearance as Zafar in the television series Spooks (2004-2007).

He also appeared in Mistresses (2008-09), Homeland (2014), The Enemy Within (2019), and Elementary (2019) as Hari, Asar, and Andrew (2014-15). Raza featured in films as well as on television. Dirty War (2004), The Crew (2008), Sex and the City 2 (2010), The Rhythm Section (2020), and others are among his films. Raza is a gifted singer as well. He was a member of a funk band in his early years. He frequently performs with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra and the BBC Concert Orchestra at the moment.

Read More: Actor and singer Sara Ramirez net worth, family

Who is his wife? Does he have children?

Raza Jaffrey is a husband and father. On December 27, 2014, he married the love of his life, Lara Pulver, who is also an English actress, in a private ceremony. After working on the same television show, Spooks, the couple began dating in late 2011. Aside from that, the couple is happily married and has a good bond. Furthermore, they show unconditional affection for one another and frequently appear in public together.

In 2020, the couple will mark their five-year wedding anniversary. In addition, the couple’s marriage appears to be in good health, with no symptoms of divorce. Raza is the delighted father of a single child. He and his wife, Lara Pulver, welcomed their first child, a son, in February 2017. He had previously been married to Miranda Raison, another Soopks actress. In addition, the couple exchanged their wedding vows.

Read More: Actor and singer Sara Ramirez net worth, family

Raza wiki: early life, parents, education, nationality and age

He was born in Liverpool, England, on May 28, 1975. Hyder Jaffrey and Joan Bradshaw are his father and mother’s names, respectively. Raza is of Asian and English ancestry, with an Indian father and a British mother.

In terms of education, he attended Dulwich College from 1986 to 1991. He then went to Manchester University to study English and Drama. In December 2021, he will be 46 years old.
